p:
Being the first step in the infection process, the entry of pathogenic viruses into susceptible cells is an extremely attractive intervention point. As with other well-known viruses, such as HIV-1 and Ebola, viral entry of coronaviruses is a complex multiple-step process with numerous interactions and processing points that, in theory, could be targeted.
33 In this review, we summarize case studies and highlight efforts in designing entry inhibitors against SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV, and other coronaviruses that can provide important information to combat the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak.
